HiPi::Device::GPIO::Pin

HiPi::Device::GPIO::Pin provides an implementation of HiPi::Pin for the HiPi::Device::GPIO module

The module inherits all of most of its methods from HiPi::Pin.

Example Usage

use 5.14.0; # for say
use HiPi::Device::GPIO;
use HiPi::Constant qw( :raspberry );

my $dev  = HiPi::Device::GPIO->new();
my $pin  = $bcm->get_pin( RPI_PAD1_PIN_11 );
my $mode = $pin->mode();

if( $mode & RPI_PINMODE_OUTP ) {
    # set high
    $pin->value(1);
} elsif(  $mode & RPI_PINMODE_INPT ) { 
    say q(Current Pin Value is :) . $pin->value();

    # set rising edge interrupt
    $pin->interrupt( RPI_INT_RISE );
}

Custom Methods

As the kernel device driver for the GPIO allows you to reverse the high / low logic for a pin, the module provides a method to control that.
$pin->active_low( [ $onoff ] );
    Returns the current active low setting for the pin.
    Either 1 or 0 for on or off.
    
    If the optional param $onoff is supplied ( 1 or 0 )
    that setting is applied to the pin.
